intro: Hieracium urumoffii, commonly known as the Urumoff's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium urumoffii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, demonstrating resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
